title: India Will Engage Startups For AI-Centric Digital Public Infrastructure: IT Minister Vaishnaw
author: livemint
description: The Indian government plans to invest in an AI computing infrastructure with 10,000 or more GPUs through a public-private partnership. They also aim to create AI innovation centers and obtain high-quality datasets to support researchers and startups in the field. The government intends to accelerate the growth of deeptech and AI financing startups as part of India's AI mission. © 2024 TechXtic. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: The Indian government plans to invest in an AI computing infrastructure with 10,000 or more GPUs through a public-private partnership. They also aim to create AI innovation centers and obtain high-quality datasets to support researchers and startups in the field. The government intends to accelerate the growth of deeptech and AI financing startups as part of India's AI mission. © 2024 TechXtic. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: Creator marketplace and talent management firm, Collective Artists Network, has acquired storytelling platform
author: livemint
description: Creator marketplace and talent management firm, Collective Artists Network, has acquired storytelling platform Terribly Tiny Tales in a move to expand its presence as a new media company. Terribly Tiny Tales, founded in 2013, has a community of over five million creators and hosts content on platforms such as Instagram and YouTube. With a weekly engagement of 25 million people, the platform offers valuable opportunities for brands to share their stories. This acquisition aligns with Collective Artists Network's strategy to support storytelling and establish itself as a leading new media company. © 2024 TechXtic. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: Creator marketplace and talent management firm, Collective Artists Network, has acquired storytelling platform Terribly Tiny Tales in a move to expand its presence as a new media company. Terribly Tiny Tales, founded in 2013, has a community of over five million creators and hosts content on platforms such as Instagram and YouTube. With a weekly engagement of 25 million people, the platform offers valuable opportunities for brands to share their stories. This acquisition aligns with Collective Artists Network's strategy to support storytelling and establish itself as a leading new media company. © 2024 TechXtic. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: Amazon and other US companies in crosshairs on warehouse safety
author: Economic Times
description: Lawmakers in Washington, D.C. have introduced the Warehouse Worker Protection Act (WWPA), a federal bill that seeks to regulate productivity targets in the warehousing industry. The bill requires companies to disclose productivity targets to employees and prohibits employers from holding workers to standards that jeopardize their safety. Advocates argue that workers deserve consistent safety standards, while opponents, such as the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, view the bill as burdensome. Several states, including California, New York, and Minnesota, have already implemented similar laws to protect warehouse workers from unsafe working conditions. Amazon, which operates the largest warehouses in the U.S., faces scrutiny for its working practices. © 2024 TechXtic. All rights reserved For personal use only.

Advocates argue that workers deserve consistent safety standards, while opponents, such as the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, view the bill as burdensome. Several states, including California, New York, and Minnesota, have already implemented similar laws to protect warehouse workers from unsafe working conditions. Amazon, which operates the largest warehouses in the U.S., faces scrutiny for its working practices. © 2024 TechXtic. All rights reserved For personal use only.
